Text: ...I finished.

My book... Well, it only has a few pages, and it
hasn't been bound, so it's just a thin, folded
booklet...

But I was able to write a story. The first...story
written by me.

Creating a story on paper from the notes on Master
Shadow’s actions and words is pretty difficult...

I've given it shape, but I have no confidence about
whether it is any good...

It is great just to enjoy reading stories written by
someone else, but writing a story myself is hard...

As each day passes, as I spend more and more time
with Master Shadow, I've come to really see his
splendor, his greatness.

So describing his deeds should naturally create an
amazing story.

...Or so I thought. This isn't interesting. It's just
a series of scenes.

I made an itemized list of everything Master Shadow
has done, but it didn't change anything.

I can't convey all of his magnificence,
his thoughtfulness, his charm!
How many times did I yell this as I made revisions?

What do you call this, just written facts... Yeah, a
newspaper. It's like that.

I can’t say with conviction that this is interesting
as a story. I can’t convey Master Shadow’s charm.
It isn't exciting to read.

Hmm... I wonder if there is anyone who can give me
advice...

What do you think...? Please give me your honest
impression.

It's good...? Beta, you raised the bar yourself.
But if you insist...

I-It's weird isn’t it? It doesn't establish a
story...?

Your story...kind of exaggerates Shadow's deeds,
don't you think? Well, it is interesting to read.

Lady Alpha has a wry smile as she looks at the
freshly written booklet.

Of course, even I can agree on his abilities.
But... Well...

"With just a slight touch of Shadow's hand on the
soil of the earth, the withered wasteland burst into
bloom with countless flowers"...?

"He descended in front of the infamous 100 Thieves!
They threw themselves to the ground at the sight of
his godly visage and, with nary a sword drawn,
swore thereafter to return to the path of good"...?

Hmm... Well, it is a bit much. If you could make it a
little more based on fact―

If I just record the facts as they are, they aren't
interesting! I can't convey Master Shadow's
charms at all!
Um, I see...

It might be a little exaggerated, but it is what my
eyes saw!

...I get it! I get it. The things Master Shadow does
look flashier than what is actually happening!
Right?! I knew you would understand, Epsilon.

But this short-haired elf that suddenly appears mid-
story to serve at Master Shadow’s side? She feels
a bit too familiar... I don't think she's needed?

B-But the storyteller is important, right? I can't
remove her!

(Of course the elf is important. The scenes of Master
Shadow's deeds don’t convey his charm enough.)

(So I introduced a storyteller. Master Shadow’s deeds
are passionately recounted through her eyes. She is
key to the story!)

I guess. Anyway, I think this is great to read!
Well, except for that elf...

...Yeah, she is too overly-familiar! We don’t need
any short-haired elf!
Why do you keep emphasizing the elf?

Look, I have an idea. We get rid of that short-haired
elf, and instead we have a beautiful elf with pigtails
come into the story!
What? Huh?!

I think a beautiful elf with pigtails is more easily
visualized than some plain short-haired elf.
No! I can't change the storyteller!
Now now, no more arguing, you two.

I see, it fills out the story more from the facts,
but... Heheh, well... If it is an interesting read,
then I guess it is okay.

U-Um... Epsilon? Lady Alpha? Do you both really think
it's interesting?

Yes, it's very interesting. I think perhaps you
really do have a talent for writing, Beta.

Me... A talent for writing. I'm not...I'm not sure I
do.
Well, don't we have this great book that you wrote?
Book...?

It is definitely thinner than the books sold at the
market, and it hasn't been bound, but this is a
book nonetheless.

Lady Alpha, do you really see this as a book...?
Can I take all of your praise seriously?
You can take my words seriously.

Certainly, your book has no direct relation with the
Shadow Garden's mission. But having confidence
about something will definitely have a positive
impact on your missions.

I think if you can have confidence in how you live,
then you won't be visited by nightmares again...
Yes, I definitely think so.
Sounds like you are all having fun.
M-Master Shadow?! Um, ah...

Huh? Did you just hide something behind your back?
Is it bad if I see it...?
I-It's not like that at all, but...
Beta, come on. Why not let Master Shadow read it too?
Because...it's...it’s not ready yet...
Heheh. Shadow, don't let it concern you.
Well, if you say so.

...So why didn't you let Shadow see it? He would be
happy. Are you still not confident about it...?
No... It's not that.

But this story—Master Shadow's story has only just
begun. This is just the prologue. And also I can't
say that I can describe Master Shadow's charm yet.

I want to continue writing his story while at his
side. I really do. Until the day I feel confident
enough to let Master Shadow read it.
I see. I hope that day comes soon.
...Me too!

At that time I was still young, and had only written
a booklet. I never thought to myself that it would
later become the draft of the first chapter of
"The Chronicles of Master Shadow".
